title: How do I set an emailed ringtone to my Samsung Galaxy S6 Edge Plus ringtones?

thread.text: I have a email that has a ringtone in it..i downloaded the email..i can hear it on my phone..but after that its in "My Drive" in which I cant find once u look for it when I want to add ringtone..how can I add to my ringtones/

Actually download the song to your phone. If it's in your google drive find it there and long press the icon for it and then hit the down arrow icon that will appear to download. From there if the song is the right file type it will show up in the list of options in your ringtone setting in the phone. If it doesn't find where the file downloaded to (you should have an app called "downloads" and long press there --> set as --> ringtone.

FWIW I also get through a day on the Galaxy S6, but not as comfortably."seems like a bug. clear data in the camera app, restart the phone. if it persists, return the phone for a new one.Only have an international version, sorry. Chances are you'll be able to disable most of it, uninstall very little of it.Nope.Speaker is on the bottom next to the USB port, just like the GS6. It's passable for notifications, ringtones and speakerphone calls, but isn't all that great for listening to music or podcasts. Definitely go with an external speaker or headphones.It's pretty slippery, mostly because there just isn't much metal on the sides of the phone and the curve isn't really helping your hand wrap around it at all. I still don't feel comfortable holding it without a case, just like the regular GS6 edge. 
The M8 is pretty slippery as well, but for different reasons — that phone just doesn't have anything to hold onto, and the materials are soooo slick. The M8 is at least small enough that you can wrap your hand around it.With the latest software updates the GS6 & GS6 edge are pretty responsive even with 3GB of RAM. The extra 1GB isn't going to do much to change that in either direction — that's all about just holding extra apps and processes in memory.

thread.text:
Thanks for the answer about the M8/slipperiness. Thinking of upgrading from my M8. How good / useful is the fingerprint sensor? Do you use it? Is it accurate?
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Use it every day as my primary phone unlock. Accurate and fast.Not sure how the GS6 edge+ would have better battery life than the Note 5. They have all of the exact same internals and battery size. The battery life is the same.
And yes, the only difference is the curved screen and the S Pen. You either get the edge screen features — of which there are simply a handful — or you get the flat screen with the S Pen functionality. The rest is identical.
Fingerprint sensor on the At&t version I have is pretty accurate and fast. I use it for purchases, lastpass, and phone unlock.

thread.text: I have been a Note user for the past 3 phones. I liked them b/c of the battery long life and changable battery. Now it seems like the S6E+ is on par if not slighlty better than N5. You have both phones is the only difference the S-Pen now? Everything else except form factor/screen/edge and size/weight are identical. Only difference appears to be the pen and the edge really? Am I missing something and if not b/c you have played with both for a few days now which one would you use as the daily driver and why? Thanks

replies.text:
Use it every day as my primary phone unlock. Accurate and fast.Not sure how the GS6 edge+ would have better battery life than the Note 5. They have all of the exact same internals and battery size. The battery life is the same.
And yes, the only difference is the curved screen and the S Pen. You either get the edge screen features — of which there are simply a handful — or you get the flat screen with the S Pen functionality. The rest is identical.

thread.text:
Have you noticed weak cell signal? I've had my edge+ for nearly 3 months now and I have horrible reception, missed and dropped calls every day, sometimes it can take hours to send a text. My phone will show connection to LTE but apps and web won't load, I get network communication errors while trying to do speed tests, and service will bounce from full LTE to full 3G to 1x and then no service at all. I'm on Sprint but have really good service in all the areas I travel to. It doesn't matter where I go, I could park my car 10 yards from a Sprint tower and my service still acts up like this. I've been reading horror stories about the antenna's Samsung used in these and the S6' and Note 5's.. Sprint devices seem to be the worst, but the internet is full of complaints from customers of all providers. I'm stuck in a 2 year lease and Sprint will not do anything except exchange for another edge+, I'm currently on my second device, had the first one replaced but no change. I'm desperate, I love this phone other than that but that's a pretty serious issue seeing that the whole point of a communication device is to communicate and that is the only thing I can't regularly do.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text: YIKES! I have had zero issues with signal! Is it perhaps the carrier in your area? I will say that I had the S6, and had the same exact problems that you are describing. When I changed to the S6 Edge+, I have had zero issues since I picked this bad boy up in the beginning of September. In fact, I have had such great signal that I don't have to use the wifi at work (with the S6 I HAD to use the wifi). I would check with your carrier. Typically on their end they can do a signal check.

thread.text: ugh. lovely. glad I ordered the 64GB then. This was one of my favorite features on my current S5.

title: Phone internal memory.

thread.text:
Hi folks. I know that if you fill the internal memory alot the phone will eventually slowdown. I currently have 55% storage filled up on my edge plus and i would like to know if that's too much.. lack of memory card hurts :b 
Thanks.
Posted via the Android Central App

The slowdown can be from different things. Errors in cache files that need to be cleared, a restart might help, a reset may be needed. I have had devices that were 80% filled and had no noticable slowdowns.
You might also try an app like Power Clean. It has a junk clean option that I use about once a week to keep things running smoothly.

Power Clean and Clean Master are both great apps to use that "wipe" unnecessary junk from your device. Some claim they use a good bit of device resources such as RAM and battery but I've never experienced any adverse effects. You can also try shutting off your device and then pressing and holding the volume down, home button, and power buttons all at the same time until it boots back up. You'll see a weird little drunk (lol not really drunk but funny) android guy and a message that says downloading or download failure (don't panic). You will then see a list of commands that you can select by scrolling with volume up or down buttons. Highlight the wipe cache partition and hit power button, this will free up some additional space and helps prevent screwy behavior. After cache wipe (only takes a few seconds), use the volume button to scroll to and highlight restart device and press power button again. Your device will restart as normal. I try to do this about once a week or so. Also, while device is on and running, make sure your screen is "awake" and you can press and hold volume down and power button until phone shuts down, this is Samsung's equivalent of removing the battery. It gives the device a nice soft reset and can solve a bunch of minor annoyances, especially if you've nearly filled your storage. Best of luck to you!
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Is it worth buying the galaxy s6 edge plus today?

thread.text:
I saved my money to by the note 5, but im living in europe and the note 5 wont come here.
Now im thinking to buy the galaxy s6 edge plus, but is it worth it?
My friends have told me to wait because the new galaxy s7 will be out very soon.
I really need a phone because I have no phone at the moment, but if the new galaxy s7 is worth waiting , then I can wait.
What do you guys think? Should I go for the galaxy s6 edge plus or should I wait for the new galaxy s7. Will the galaxy s7 be much better? Any ideas?

The note 5 will come to Europe in early 2016. The s7 hasn't been released so we won't know the improvements. 
The Samsung Galaxy Note 5 will finally arrive in Europe in early 2016 http://www.androidcentral.com/galaxy...o-sale-january

I LOVE this phone! I would say it is def worth it! Usually I upgrade as soon as the new version comes out, but unless the S7 has come magic ability to print money, I am staying with the S6 Edge Plus!!!

As someone else mentioned, you should be able to get the Note 5 in Europe early next year. If you can't wait for then, you'd be waiting at least until March for the S7 release and then paying top prices for it.
If Samsung continues the 3GB ram on the regular S vs. 4GB on the Edge+, then 820 or not, the Edge+ will far outperform the S7. The biggest difference I felt between the S6 and the + was no lag in the + even after 4 months, and much faster. With Samsung's poor use of memory that last 1GB made all the difference.
I also find the screen size of the regular S far less appealing for video consumption. So to sum up, based on rumors and speculation od what's in the S7, I would either get the S6 Edge+ now or wait for a few weeks and get the Note 5.
Posted via the Android Central App

The only issue I would say to watch for with the Edge or Edge+ is signal strength problems. It isn't every single device or every network, I happen to have a device on a network that is afflicted with this problem. However, I'd say after 3 months of using the Edge+, it's definitely worth the buy!! Samsung is usually pretty good at finding and fixing bugs in their devices with updates, but they are usually very slow and hush hush about release dates. Again, minor issues are evident with every flagship device of every make and model, you just have to ask yourself if you're willing to commit to a specific brand, and tolerate minor, inconvenient glitches while they're being investigated and ironed out. (Talk about 1st world problems lol) best of luck to you.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: My experience with a cheotech fast wireless charger

thread.text:
Hey guys I'm doing a review for the choetech fast wireless charger T513-S .
Link for product: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B017U9FVKW...cUvbUpU4897030
I'll try to make this simple and straight to the point.
I will be breaking this into sections so lets go at it okay? Ready? Great!
Packaging, what's included, and pictures - I thought it was great packaging. It was straight to the point at protecting the product and easy to remove from the box. I've in the past dealt with boxes that are literally a maze to open. I'd love it if it came with chocolate though. It did included the usual manual, warranty card, and a USB cable which can serve as the main USB cable or a spare. 
Product durability/stability/usage - when I held the fast wireless charging unit in my hand I thought it felt very durable. I even dropped it by mistake and thought it would not work or even worse crack but to my surprise it worked just fine.* Over the course of 1 week and a few days I kept it at my work station at work and I and few Android users at work used it on and off. It didn't once give issues with any devices except a nexus 6 which is curved at the back so it wouldn't sit properly nor charge at full speed but that's obviously due to lack of fast wireless support. I'd say it has stood its ground so far when using it on my galaxy s6 edge+.
Likes and dislikes - I personally didn't like that my s6 edge + takes over pretty much all of the size of the pad but that isn't a product issue as they do offer a more square option for someone who dislikes this version. I did like that it's all eco friendly packaging and of course it includes a nice USB cable which comes in handy in my opinion as you can never have too many. Its my first fast wireless charger that takes advantage of fast charging wireless on my s6 edge + so obviously another like! I lastly liked the price of $36! That's super cheap compared to samsungs solution. That is about it regarding the likes and dislikes.
Overall I'd highly recommend this product if you're seeking to take advantage of fast wireless charging to max out the charging rate of your device (note 5 and s6 edge+). Even if you don't have a fast wireless charging device it is still nice. My co workers with galaxy s6 units all loved it as it is nice to be able to sit down and pick up your device easily. If you don't own one already, go to Amazon and order one as it does include an amazing 18 month warranty so you can't go wrong. ;-)
What did you actually plug it into? A PC? The original wall adapter that came with the phone?

replies.text: In order to take advantage of the fast wireless charger you must plug it into your quick charge 2.0 power adapter as you would your phone. :-)
Thanks. That's pretty much what I figured.

thread.text: I have a different model charger from the same company. Great product. Great company .

title: Was Charging Phone And Fell Asleep -__- Does This Damage The Phone Or Battery?

thread.text: So i was charging my 6edge plus cuz it needed to be charged but i fell aslep cuz i was freaking tired and i forgot i was charging it. probably been a few hours. does over charging the phone damage the phone or the battery? this is the first time this has happened. should i be worried?
No. It will stop charging once the charge is full. I've charged every smartphone I've owned overnight while I was sleeping and never had battery issues.
thanks for the reply. i didnt know it stops charging once its fully charged.. is this the only phone that does this or s it cause its a smartphone and stuff?
Not just phones, but all modern devices that use lithium ion batteries like notebook computers, tablets, cordless drills, toys.
I believe it is the circuit in the battery that stops charging.
whats that mean? o.o the circuit stops charging but something else is still charging inside?

replies.text: No it means that the circuit in the battery stops the battery from over charging 😉

thread.text: ohh!! great news at least i dont have to worry bout overcharging it.. i was so upset lol

replies.text: It's worse for the battery to let it drain too much. Lithium ion batteries have no memory like the old nickel cadmium batteries. Lithium ion batteries last longer if they aren't discharged too low too often. It's best to charge it when it gets to around 40% and not let it get lower than that on a regular basis. Topping off the battery regularly helps it last longer, for instance putting it on a car charger on the way home from work.

thread.text: I had to replace 2 batteries on my previous to previous s3 because they got fat from what I was told was overcharging. The cover wouldn't close and the batteries' charge got progressively worse. Perhaps battery technology has greatly improved in the 3 or so years since but I don't overcharge.

Can't be changed unless you are rooted and edit the actual system img files. Remember icon packs only work in third party apps such as Nova, Apex, and such. So when you're outside of the launcher such as in messages or in Google Chrome it will always use stock icons.
I don't think those icons can be altered. Thinking about it, I saw the same thing in an older version of Android (4.3 as I recall) when I had icon packs installed.
I agree with dpham00, those can't be changed. The launcher can change the icons just on the home screens and the app drawer.

title: Night clock shows delayed time

thread.text:
Does anyone else have the problem I've been having? My night clock is usually several minutes behind the actual time on my device. When I turn the screen on and back off again, the time on the night clock 'refreshes' back to the correct time. Until the next time I notice it - and it is lagging behind again.
Any ideas why? Is anyone else having this issue?

Its just happened to me - but I have a theory!
Back later

OK my theory was wrong...I thought it was related to battery power
My symptoms are the same as yours...
Now I am puzzled!

What is your device model? Mine is G928C
Wonder if it is device specific.

Mine is a G928-F.
I logged a call with Samsung who advised me by email to do a factory reset (full text below). I was sceptical this would fix it but sometimes you have to try these things if you want to progress it further. It didn't fix it for me...mayble I am just too cynical having worked in IT for nearly 40 years!
I would recommend you perform a full factory data reset on your phone. A factory reset will erase all of the information stored on your device and will restore the software to original manufacturer settings. It will not remove software updates but it can undo any changes to settings that might be causing you problems.
In order to back up your data, you will need to install Smart Switch onto your PC. You can download Smart Switch from the following link:Transfer Data from Samsung to Samsung Galaxy | Smart Switch
Once Smart Switch is installed, please follow these steps:
1. Connect your device to your computer using the Samsung USB Cable that came with your device (the charging cable with the plug head removed)
2. Open Smart Switch and click the Back Up/Restore tab.
3. Click Data Backup
4. Mark the check box next to the content you want to back up. You can select all content by marking the check box next to Select all Items. Click Backup.
5. Click Complete when the backup is finished.
6. You can have Smart Switch automatically back up your device every time it’s connected by clicking the check box next to Automatically back up when USB connection is established.
To factory reset the device please follow the next steps:
1. From the Home Screen, tap the Applications menu item.
2. Tap on Settings.
3. Scroll down to Back up and Reset.
4. Tap the Factory Data Reset menu item.
5. Tap the Reset phone button.
6. Tap the Erase Everything button.
If you rquire additional assistance, please contact us on 0330 726 7864 (UK) or 0818 717 100 (EIRE)z
Such a typically lazy response from Samsung - very Microsoft like.
Still happening for me. Is this an uncommon issue?

I'm having this issue as well on my Edge+, it also happens for the clock on the screen, I'll check it, and see it increment up to 5 or 6 minutes. It might say 3:30 and I'll open it and see it go 3:31, 3:32, 3:33, 3:34, 3:35 all in about half a second. Night clock always matches up to what it shows. I haven't had the phone that long at all, and aside from transferring over the apps from my old phone, haven't really done anything weird. I'm still using the default lock screen image etc.
Worst part, this seems to affect my alarms. They don't go off until the clock shows the time they are waiting on. There was one update after I got the phone, and that's when I noticed this start to happen.
I also had this issue with the last samsung flip phone I had, but it was much worse, and I didn't see it count up like that. With that phone, changing back to the default theme fixed it.

I have a funny feeling it has something to do with the app optimization feature which landed after our last updates. Maybe the night clock is being put into sleep mode or something? Hoping an update would soon fix this issue.
Nothing to do with time zones. The time is lagging behind by 2 to 15 minutes.

Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
This is normal behavior. The phone IS capable of becoming brighter than the brightest possible setting will allow but this is reserved for an emergency maneuver when out in full sunlight (or similar very bright situations). It's very taxing on the battery and the phone will not go into this "turbo" brightness mode unless the situation calls for it. Its only purpose is to boost visibility in the sun, the software does not allow you to set the screen this high a level of brightness manually.
This is regardless of having the auto-brightness setting on or off. No, it does not mean you have a defective unit, it is the opposite.Display outdoor visibility comparison: Samsung Galaxy S6 vs Apple iPhone 6 vs HTC One M9 vs Note 4

replies.text:
You can control the brightness of the phone ranging from 2 nits to around 450 nits. In extreme situations where outdoor visibility becomes an issue, the display overpowers itself to over 750 nits. This has been tested and proven multiple times from different sources and it's a feature of the phone. It's not a defect and it's set this way because that kind of brightness is not recommended for extended periods of time (both for the battery's sake and the display's).

Do you work for Samsung or something dude is that why you are so vehemently defending them? Jeez. Have I seen, with my own two eyes, an official release about it? And if this is some weird auto-brightness setting that is not a defect, then why is it happening on my Verizon phone but not happening on my girl's Sprint phone? I didn't see you respond to acknowledge that.

I didn't reply to that because all the proof we have to go on with that subject is your word, which -as I have quoted above- is not very accurate. I have two S6 Edge+ as I have shown on this thread and experience none of these mysterious screen defects.
What you're describing however sounds exactly like the outdoor brightness overdrive mode described here. It's NOT a defect and it's just normal behavior of the screen. It's basically like a speed governor in a car in which theoretically, the car could go faster but is electronically limited by a computer for the safety of the engine and the driver.
I'm not defending Samsung because I don't have to, I'm just stating facts. What you're describing isn't a defect, but I can tell that you're aggravated that you can't turn up your screen brightness past the software limitation in which case I have no solution for you. But don't try to drum up controversy on these forums by trying to convince us (and yourself) that there's somehow some widespread screen defect that exists with these devices and Samsung has "already acknowledged it" (according to Verizon according to you). It's a whole bunch of "he said she said" trying to pass off as facts, but without evidence.
Now if you can actually provide us with some visual proof of this defect that you or someone else has presented (being so allegedly widespread as it is) like a Youtube video or something then I'd be more than happy to help you troubleshoot this problem. Until then, judging from my own devices, I can't say there's any issue here aside from your perception of what you should and shouldn't be able to do with the screen brightness regardless of the software settings.
If you really want full control of the hardware, then root your device. If you're so convinced that your device has a software bug then take control of the situation and install your own software. Because as far as I can tell, none of us here have any solutions for you. Trying to convince us that there's a bug on the software when none of us can replicate the symptoms won't really get us anywhere either.

title: Help! Battery dying while phone off

thread.text:
This is not so much a tip but I have an issue.
Had brand new Samsung Galaxy S6 edge PLUS delivered yesterday.
After courier left I opened packaging and noticed the ' don't accept if seal broken' had been opened.
I checked everything very very thoroughly including all accessories (very familiar with S6) and nothing at all had been touched. The cable was defo in factory state.
Now the issue , I gave the phone a good test bearing in mind you need many days and fully charged and then put back in the box for the night definitely off. In the morning the battery had gone from 100% to 67%. The phone was definitely not on through the night.
I have played a bit with it today and just put it 'to bed' again on 100% and will check again in the morning.
Can anyone give any advice?
Thank you.
Posted via the Android Central App

The phone will lose some power during power-off and even more during power-on (rebooting is the same), but it shouldn't be more than a couple percent points at most. It definitely shouldn't be depleting your battery if it's off overnight. Batteries will lose charge even if not used but that takes days, not a few hours...

title: How do I set up my trusted devices on my Samsung Galaxy 6 Edge Plus?

thread.text: I am having trouble finding the appropriate function for setting up my trusted devices

Welcome to Android Central! First, make sure the devices are connected via Bluetooth. Next, go to Settings>Lockscreen & Security>Secure Lock Settings>Smart Lock>Trusted Devices, and select the desired Bluetooth devices.

title: Great Phone, Bad Device!

thread.text:
I wonder if anyone else is having the same problems I am having with my GS6Edge+.
First of all, I love the phone, the screen, size, speed, battery all good.
My problem started 2 weeks or so ago, the screen started getting non responsive. First it would take 10 seconds to react to repeated swipes, other times nothing would work at all for 20-30 seconds. Then it would come back. This has been going on off and on for the last 10 days, really bad at times today.
Also, starting last Sunday, the phone radio/signal started turning off on it's own. Happened 6-7 times in the last week, again today too. It's got a little curse.
Anyway, I took it into Verizon last Tuesday and they switched out the sim card. My 14 days was up the next day, so they said come back then if I was still having problems. Of course I had no problems until this thursday/friday. Took it in again, but now it's a warranty claim. My "new" phone arrives tomorrow, hopefully no more bugs.
Anyone else have weirdness with the screen or phone signal going out?
You wouldn't happen to have an Invisible Shield screen protector on your S6 Edge+? I installed one on mine today and have been experiencing the same screen and touch issues you describe above.
Nope, no screen protectors here!
I've nor read of other reports like this - hopefully your replacement device will be better.
It definitely makes me feel better than no one is responding and agreeing with me. I'm sure the new device will be great!

The biggest problem to me is inconsistent battery life. My phone still lost 20% juice overnight being idle. No matter how I make adjustment.
I had installed battery monitor app(GSAM) but it doesn’t help. I am only able to know the Android system sucks the major power but do not know which part it is. Is there any app that can help me figure out which part that sucks 20% power at night? Thanks.

replies.text: I don't have an answer to your immediate problem, but why not charge your phone at night?

Sorry i am a bit anxious about letting electronic devices charge without monitoring. Thus, I unplug before sleeping. 
I have noticed many users in my country reported same. It seems to be a escalating issue.
You're definitely not alone on this issue, I have the same. Do you have the night clock turned on? That feature takes at least 5% juice if I turn on the night clock for 5-7hrs.

thread.text: If your non-responsive issue has anything to do with the time when you try to wake your phone from screen off mode, then this is a known software issue. Some folks claim that after the last update, the issue was fixed. Others like me, still have had no luck and are awaiting the next software patch.
See here http://forums.androidcentral.com/sho...d.php?t=596111

Certainly seems like it was similiar to this. Mine also had the radio turning off almost daily.
My new device, which I've had now for 4-5 days, has had no issues. So far so good.

title: Lock Screen Question

thread.text:
Just picked up an Edge+ yesterday and really like it, a lot. Very pleased.
I set up the "fingerprint" function to unlock the phone, which works perfectly unless I'm outside and it's cold.
My issue is that when I have the phone near and connected to a "trusted device" such as my smartwatch or my vehicle's bluetooth, I thought I should be able to turn on the phone and have it unlocked without having to use the fingerprint or enter the secondary password.
Am I doing something wrong, or is this a known issue? Thanks.

Mine will also do this on occasion, don't know if it's a known issue or not. I do not have an issue with cold weather though.
Verizon S6 Edge+
Inconsistent function, turned it off.

I have mine set up the same way. It generally works, but I do have occasional times when it doesn't. I haven't noticed anything about the cold but I do notice that sometimes the first thing in the morning it doesn't work. But generally, I'm happy with it.

I figured out my problem. I feel pretty foolish. The cold was not affecting it. And it was correctly unlocked while connected with a trusted device. It's just that I did not realize that the screen was functioning a certain way. Just needed a general swipe on the screen to unlock. My bad.

title: Is there a sticker or did the salesperson chip my device?

thread.text:
Hey all! Got my Edge+ yesterday, and the salesperson at the AT&T store said she would get "all the protective stickers going" because "they're pretty hidden and a bit tough to get off." So, she looked about and used her nails to start the flash sticker and then she did one she said was on the home button/fingerprint sensor. I got it home, and was going to finish the job. The flash sticker came off easy, but trying to get one off the home button where she "started" isn't going well. There is a small...something at the right side of the button where the metal frame touches the button, but I cannot seem to get a sticker off. Is there a sticker, or did she chip the button? 
tl;dr: Salesperson tried to start getting off sticker on home button, but I can't find one. Is one there, or is this darker area near the edge a chip in the metal?

There's USUALLY a sticker, but for some reason some have it and some don't... However, it's very easy to tell: Fingerprint reader. Does it work? There's no sticker. It doesn't work and keeps saying to wipe it? Sticker. 
The material on the button does look a little different than the rest and some might confuse that for a thin film on the button.

When in doubt get more lol
Posted via the Android Central App

Decisions,decisions...
I think there are a number of questions I would ask before making a final choice. I'm not going to start the IOS Vs. Android discussion - I will leave others to do that!
1) Do you think you will have access to any Wifi whilst you are away? If you do then this would help your cloud backups
2) What resolution will you be shooting videos at/? I've not had much success with UHD capture but that may be just the way I am trying to play them back. I'm sure you know the higher the resolution (and the longer the clip) the more storage they take up. This also applies to photos but it sounds like you don't take too many of them.
3) Choice of phone: This is really a personal matter so I can only answer based on my own experience. In my case I wanted an Edge+ in gold 32GB but would had to have waited so went for the black and am happy with it.
If I was facing your choice I would probably go for the 64GB but it really depends how important the gold colour is to you! 
Let us know how you get on!

title: changing LED color for notifications?

Yes you can change LED color without the need to install any 3rd party app. Its probably deep somewhere in the settings. It also depends on the custom skin your Android is running on. The setting to change led colour is normally within the notification section of the app itself.

title: How is it after having a S6 Edge Plus?

thread.text:
Hey S6 Edge Plus owners out there! After having a S6 Edge Plus, do you have any regrets? How do you rate it? Any favorite or lacking apps? Let us hear from each other.
Posted via the Android Central App

I've had my 6+ about a month now and I love it to bits. 
Things i love:
The design. I love the curved edges but not a big fan (yet) of the app usage of the edges. I don't like the blue led at night - but it may be possible to switch this off in the do not disturb settings. It is a perfect fit for my big hands.
The Apps: Because I travel a lot by train I have train widgets set for each leg of my journey so I can see how long I am going to be delayed. I have some Sonic games which I play every day. Apart from that weather and news app and of course email for home and work.
Battery life: Not a problem to me - I do hammer my phone usage so charge it when I can and leave it to charge overnight.
I would give this phone a 9 out of 10....

I'm coming from an iPhone and then a Note 4 and this is the best phone I've ever had. It's quick, has the features that I want, and like everyone says, it's a beautiful phone and has an excellent screen. The battery has not been a problem for me yet. I charge it though whenever I'm at my desk during the day. No regrets at all.

coming from a 2013 (original) Motorola X. It's a totally different experience. I do miss how well my moto x fit in my hand but this phone blows it out of the water. 
Pros:
screen is absolutely gorgeous. if you haven't tried one in store, you'll be amazed whenever you do. 
the phone is lightning fast. coming from my old phone, maybe it's more noticeable for me, but this thing freaking flies. 
the battery life is great. I've gotten about 6 hours of screen on time. I charge it every night. I pull it out of charging around 4am and plug it back in around 8 or 9. usually makes it through the day, unless there's heavy usage, then I usually have to charge it midway through just for a bit. my moto x would have never lasted this long. 
fast charging is great. I plug this in while I take a shower or play a quick round of cod or browse reddit, and I'm 40% up. 
I like the notification leds.
call quality is supurb
fingerprint reader is awesome, and works 80% or the time. 
Cons:
the edge glass is pointless. it makes for a sexy phone though. 
it's a little too big for me to use with one hand
I hope this helps and good luck.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Agree with all of the above except battery life, but to each his own. I did have a lot longer battery life on my iPhone, however, this is the best Android phone I've had in years.
This: "the edge glass is pointless. it makes for a sexy phone though." is exactly what I think too. I will say that the edge glass does decrease the overall width of the phone, but it's still hard to use one handed.

thread.text:
I've had mine since day one love this phone it's a keeper . As far as the edge screen I use mine all the time people edge is so convenient to use for my contact. Get this phone you'll love it . Right now best buy will give you a $250 gift card when you re up your contract

Are you on different carriers, by chance? Verizon and Sprint will not be able to support simultaneous voice and data unless you have VoLTE in your area. If you are on an MVNO (like StraightTalk, MetroPCS, etc) that uses these carriers' networks, you will also need VoLTE capability...

Thanks for the suggestion. I tried that and the effect was minimal.

I get 14 to 15 hours out of mine and I use the Internet on WiFi a lot. I watched some YouTube videos on extending battery life. My phone is always in power saving. I have the Bluetooth and location turned off except for when I need it. I never use auto lighting. The brightest I set my phone is half bar. Indoors it's on a quarter bar or less. When I charge it on my wireless charger, I put it on ultra power saving mode. When I know that I'm not going to use it for a while, I put it on ultra power saving mode. I can get over 20 hours on my battery like that. I still receive phone calls, text messages, and alarms. A video said to set your home screen to black and white because the more light there is the more the battery uses. I don't do that. The battery saving measures I use work well. I almost forgot, when I'm away from home or anywhere where I'm using the Internet on WiFi. Your phone will continuously search for WiFi when you have WiFi turned on and that drains your battery.

title: I'm having trouble receiving spam messages in my inbox

thread.text: I have a galaxy s6 edge+ and I am all of a sudden getting spam messages in my inbox on my phone but on my computer they automatically go in my spam folder. I was having trouble with emails (when I would delete them on my phone they were back in my inbox the next time I opened my mail app). I saw a thread on this site on how to change the settings so that I could permanetly delete my emails on my phone so I made that change. Ever since then all emails that go to spam on my yahoo mail when I look on my computer now go to my inbox on my edge+. Is there a setting to keep this from happening?

Same thing here with my edge + and I'm using comcast. I am using outlook app and haven't gotten anymore spam mail. Also you can foreword your email to Gmail and will fix it too. Other than that I'm lost too.

Don't need to forward to Gmail, you can add your Yahoo email account to Gmail. That's what I did and now everything goes through the Gmail app. After you add the account to Gmail, disable or uninstall your Yahoo email app. I only need the Gmail app to view my Yahoo mail and Gmail on my phone. Makes it much more simple to check my mail now. It's all in one place with the Gmail app...

title: S6 Edge+ is Running like complete garbage, how can I get it running better?

thread.text: I've recently deployed, and my Edge+ is now running unbearably slow and messed up. Apps refresh/restart themselves when I'm in the middle of the app. Keyboard disappears at random when I'm using it. I'm on the verge of shattering this phone. I've done everything I can think of to fix it but no luck. I've read the 5.1.1 update has been having issues... any advice?!

Welcome.
I don't know what you mean by 'deployed', but did you try Safe Mode? Have you tried a Cache Partition wipe? 
Also, have you tried a Factory Reset?

FDR
Who knows why it's acting out at you, but by backing up any photos and other items you have on the phone and performing a Factory Data Reset, it should solve your issues. If not, then you need to contact your tech support.
To perform a FDR: Settings/Backup and Reset/Factory data reset at the bottom. Just make sure everything that you want's been saved from the phone, because it will all be gone when the phone returns to operation.
"Deployed", as in the Military, most likely in the Middle East?

Ive had none of thise issues with mine. Perpehaps you should try a factory reset
Posted via the Android Central App

title: My phone won't fast charge anymore and cable charging only drains the battery, what should I do?

I am not sure if I can help you. But, I would recommend you to take the phone to your carrier's device center or Samsung Service center. They use compressed air in the charging port to clear any dust or water particles.

title: Why does my music skip when paired with my car Bluetooth?

thread.text:
Hi guys, new to the forum but certainly not to phone issues !
Got my S6 edge plus last week after upgrading from S6 edge. Problem is like many on here that music played through car bluetooth skips intermittently for about a second and comes back. It may happen 5 times in a song or once. I''ve tried many of the tips suggested on here but so far no dice. Problem is that the S6 edge was fine with no issues. The S6 edge plus (must stand for more headaches) is identical as it was restored with a back up from S6 edge. It sports 4gig of ram which should preclude any processor anurisms but it is very dissapointing to say the least ! I can conclusively say the it is a bluetooth issue which is weird considering thephones run identical software. Samsung is quick to point their finger at 3rd party apps as their email reply today but again the phones are just clones with one having a bigger brain, same apps same everything. The most promising improvement was to run music through power amp player which I thought had fixed it but after an hour or so murphy was back. Pretty dissapointing for what samsung claims to be their "flagship device" More annoying is the fact they want me to part with it so they can reverse engineer it in their lab to see what the cause may be and leave me to go without whilst this takes place ! 
I know this appears to be a persistent issue with a variety of handsets and the common denominator appears to be the latest software upgrade. 2 steps forward, one step back.
Any positive fixes been proven to fix this issue yet ?

Not on your life ! It is 1 week old and if I send it in they can keep it. Dont get me wrong it probably is one of the best phones out there and does most things very well. It just cant handle maintaing a quality bluetooth connection even with dual quad processors and 4gig of RAM ! Maybe it doesnt like my taste in music lol
I have the same issue, ive tested my device on many bluetooth devices and the same issue on all of them, must be some bluetooth defect, my Note 5 did this also... annoying.
My Note 4 did this as well. One would have thought the newer phones would have corrected this....

I listen to spotify and tuneIN through Bluetooth in my car and haven't had a single experience like this. The gs6 edge plus actually connects faster and more consistently to my Bluetooth in the car than my note 4 did. That is really a shame. I suppose if a factory reset of the phone and a power reset of the Bluetooth adapter in the host device, and a forget pair/re pair don't resolve it, I would return the phone? I had a similar problem awhile back with the note 3 but I disconnected my car battery for a few minutes and that reset the Bluetooth in the stereo. I also had the volume up too high on my phone before as well which caused distortion from the Bluetooth host when listening to the music. Now i keep it at about ninety percent instead of 100 on media volume setting. This is probably all stuff you've heard before. Sorry I couldn't supply the magic dust. :/.
Might as well note here that it also works flawlessly with my Bose wireless speaker through bluetooth and through the bluetooth wireless headphones "Tones."

title: Music isn't pausing when unplugging headphones

thread.text:
Hi everyone!
I got a new Galaxy S6 Edge+ last week, had it for a few days now and got to say I love it. I just have one particular problem that I'd like to ask about.
When listening music from Spotify or any other music apps or watching youtube or anything, if I unplug my headphones, or disconnect my Bluetooth headphones, the music automatically doesn't stop, but will instead switch over to phones own speaker. This also happens when I get a phone call, I can hear the music and my ringtone playing at the same time. 
Has anyone else had this problem, and if so, how did you fix it. As I said, I haven't had this phone for many days yet, and so I haven't tried the factory reset yet. That's one thing I'm gonna try though, just thinking if anyone has had this and solved it without doing the reset...
Thanks!

It is weird, because while it happens most of the time, it isn't always happening. The hardest part to understand is that I can "close" the spotify app, and it will still play music. This was never an issue before, but it is starting to get me into trouble because I am used to unplugging my headphones in a quiet place such as the library, and it will just keep blaring my music. The most annoying part is how music will continue to play even after I have answered a call.
I have uninstalled the spotify app and reinstalled it, but that did not solve the issue. I just really don't want to go through the trouble of factory resetting the phone if its not going to sovle the issue.

title: Need some advice

thread.text: I currently have a iPhone 6 Plus. Been to ATT and Best Buy a lot here lately. I've been playing with the Note 5 and the Edge+. I'm really digging the Edge +. But is it worth the extra money over the Note 5??? I'm getting kinda bored with my iPhone. Time for a change. But I've got so much money invested into iTunes. I haven't been with Android for awhile now. It's been years. Idk what to do. I would love to hear from everyone. It would be much appreciated.

replies.text:
I was in the same scenario, I love the iOS I have a lot of money invested in the ecosystem however after 4 or 5 years it gets a little boring. 
I bought an unlocked edge plus outright, no contract, and I was able to use it for 13 days before making a decision. To make it a fair decision II used only the new phone.
The screen is beautiful. There's no denying that. Both phones are capable of performing almost all the same tasks. So you won't be missing out on functionality. You'll be gaining on customization of your app's icons, apps layout, and choice of launchers. So there are a lot of pluses
In the end iPhone was the better choice For me. I found that the applications and operating system were a bit smoother, integrated a bit better and my iPhone's battery life was better. But the main factor is I was not able to get access to all of my Apple ecosystem apps, content, movies, music etc. on my new phone. There were some workarounds arounds here and there,I was able to get contacts, calendars and all the stuff the synced up to the iCloud as far as the icloud account was concerned but it was all the apps and music and movies that I purchased that I was now stuck without.
Oh and I might mention that OK Google does kick siri's *** hands-down. (If there is issues with anything that I wrote and blame it on Siri because I dictated this whole thing. )
I digress, it's a trade-off, flexibility and customization for smoothness and retaining access to all my prior media purchases.
Oh and I forgot one big thing. Apples one button back up that restores all your text messages applications and everything to your new phone completely lays waste to anything that android has in place now. (Unless you're rooted)
Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

thread.text:
I don't know why I didn't say this way earlier. 
BATTERY! 
Most people here are probably going to bash me, but keep in mind, those are the people who've never had an iPhone. There is no competition between Android and iOS when it comes to battery life. iOS wins going away. It's a 2+ to 1 difference between the two. The iPhone 6 Plus lasts twice and sometimes three times as long as this Edge +'s battery. It's not even close. I could go 2 days easy on the iPhone's battery without changing any setting, turning off GPS, setting the brightness to 25%, turning on WiFi, all the tips and tricks to get an Android phone to last a full day.
My battery experience:Start the day around 3:45am taking it off the chargerWatch NetFlix for 3 hoursRead some emailSurf some InternetUse as a hotspot for at least 4 hoursDo some gaming. Drag racing, Phrase Wheel, etc.1 - 2 phone callsEnd the day around 8pm placing it back on the chargeriPhone 6 Plus - from 100% to around 6% in a single dayiPhone 6 - Could make it close to a full day. I'd need to put it on a charger around 6pm.Sammy Galaxy 6 Edge + - Can make it maybe 6 hours
But, let's not stop there:LG G2, G3, and G4 - All could make it maybe 5 hoursDroid Turbo (You know. The 3600 mAh battery) - Could make it maybe 6 hoursHTC One M8 - Could make it maybe 4 hoursRazr Maxx and Maxx HD - Could make it maybe 9 hours
Battery life on Android phones suuuuucks, but Android has Qi charging. I have a Qi charger on my nightstand at home and on my desk at work. This is how I live.

replies.text:
It does. However not for long. 
I have my nexus 9 on marshmallow and it went from a charge every 24 hours to only charging it every 2-3 days. (Bear in mind this in my remote for my hue lights, tv, Xbox and cable only) so most of its standby but it's a massive increase in battery improved. 
Also Samsung does not right efficient code. They chew up grandma CPU cycles like its going out of style and don't have any efficiency burned into their code. So all that bloat wear is the battery sink. Not a good comparison on battery. (Unless they jump though goons autokilling background apps, toggle wifi and cell etc... ) 
Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

I've heard this after every Android update. "The battery life is dramatically improved." It never is. As for Samsung, you might be right, but all Android phones I've had are about the same on battery life. Including my Edge + and my wife's S4. They are right in line with all of the other Android phones I've had.

Lollipop was a battery bug. From my small personal experience marshmallow is a very noticeable improvement. 
I have an iPhone 6s Plus and for work I have a Samsung edge plus. I'm lucky if I get 5 hours with moderate use on my edge+
On my iPhone I'm getting double that battery life. I'm at 41% on my iPhone with almost 9 hours use and over 12 hour standby since I charged it last. 
I'm hoping marshmallow catches up. It looks like it will so far to me. We'll see. 
Sent from my iPhone using Tapatalk

While I completely agree that the iPhone 6/6s plus have better battery life than the Edge+, I would suggest not going off the "usage" stats on the iPhone. My partner has the iPhone 6 and the battery stats always shows hours upon hours of usage even though he doesn't touch his phone, literally it will just sit at his desk.
The way iOS calculates its usage is inclusive of everything that goes on with the device, including background activity. So whatever "usage" is listed on the battery stats on the iPhone does not translate to actual "Screen On Time".
From my experience, from a full charge you will get the same screen usage time on both phones but when it comes to stand-by, the iPhone will last over 3 times longer. This is a non-issue if you're a heavy user and charge your phone daily. But if you favor stand-by efficiency the iPhone is by far and away the clear winner. 
This has always been the case between iOS and Android, but the difference is bigger right now because from my personal experience Lollipop is so far the least-efficient version of Android when it comes to stand-by times.

title: S6 Edge Plus help please?

thread.text:
Hi there,
I have an issue which is really coming between me and my sleep.
Here's where I'm at - I have been using an iPhone 6S Plus for a few months which I think is a great phone. But I'm a mobile geek. And I bore easily. And I love Android Wear. I have an S6 Edge Plus which was a loan from Samsung (which they haven't asked back) and I really like the idea of it becoming my daily driver. I'm fully bought into Android as well as iOS as I've been flip flopping between the two OS' for years. And I love the openness of it.
BUT - there is one thing that is stopping me and that is this:
I do a lot of driving for work and I have a great setup with my stereo system, It connects via Bluetooth audio, I can just yell 'Hey Siri' and tell it to, say, 'play music by Louis Armstrong' and with the tight integration with Apple Music and it plays it well. I don't have to take my hands off the wheel and it streams the song within a second or two.
I've always thought Google Now much better, but I have real issues with getting it to play music. I have Spotify installed and I've also added Google Play Music Premium but Samsung appears to have crippled this a bit.. You have to have the phone charging for it to work with the screen off (no biggie - I have a charge in my car), but if I tell it to play music, it says 'OK' and then it does nothing. I have to then unlock the screen before it actually completes the command. Which obviously negates the whole point. I may as well pull over every song and manually do it.
I can't stress how frustrating this is. What I want to do is just be able to say 'OK Google, Play Madonna Holiday' and for it to play the song. Not for me to have to say that, then unlock the phone and repeat all over again.
Some points:
* All voice recognition options in the 'voice detection' settings are enabled.
* When I say 'unlock', I mean get past the lock screen. I have the S6 Edge Plus set up with both my stereo AND Android Wear watch as trusted devices, so the phone isn't refusing to do this from a security standpoint as I just have to swipe the screen to get it to the main home screen, not input a pin or scan a fingerprint.
Any ideas? Would really help me! This is such a small thing, but it really is a killer deal for me in terms of whether I can commit to this phone full time.
Thanks in advance!

I'm not sure how to fix this. I've always just dealt with it being finicky. 
I stumbled upon this app recently and it's got good reviews... but I haven't used it yet because I don't spend too much time in the car. https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...vemode.android
Posted via the Android Central App
Try premium version of Samsung Milk, thats what i use... works perfect...

Thanks both.
Drive mode works OK, but unfortunately doesn't seem to fix the issue.

title: Can I get some help with some Galaxy S6 Edge+ Wifi issues 2.4 GHz vs 5 GHz?

thread.text:
Got my new Edge+ 2 days ago and while I love the phone I want to either dropkick it or my wireless router right now. I've searched and searched and it appears that the issue is with the phone not playing nice with my router than has both 2.4 and 5 GHz. It's a WOW! (now Vast broadband) wireless router (Arris DG860). I can't find an option on the phone to force it to use 2.4 GHz only, nor can I figure out how to either create two SSIDs on the router, one for 2.4 GHz and one for 5 GHz, so that I can pick the 2.4 GHz to use from my phone, or disable the 5Ghz band. But I don't know squat about routers so maybe it's not that hard.
I know that a ton of people are having this same issue across providers, but so far the only fix seems to be nixing the 5GHz band, so I'm hoping someone can help me, as using data only is going to get expensive!

I don't have a Samsung, but to select 2.4 or 5Ghz on my Nexus I go to:
Settings > WiFi > Menu (3 dots upper right) > Advanced > WiFi frequency band > Select Automatic, 2.4 GHz or 5Ghz.
I can't tell you exactly how to assign SSIDs, that's specific to your router. If you can't find it in setup, I can only suggest checking the user manual. It's really handy to give bands separate SSIDs for easy identification, but if you set the phone to use one or the other it will pick it that band for you, you don't have to do it manually.
Here's some things to try to sort this out. I know you said you don't know much about this stuff but try to get through as best as you can. Post back here for more help:
Try these steps, in order, until it (hopefully) works. They are some of the most common fixes for stubborn WiFi connections and have been successful in many cases. Do 1-5 together, 6-10 one at a time: 
1. Go to: Settings > WiFi > Long-press on your network > Forget network. 
2. Turn off the phone. 
3. Unplug the power to the router for at least 30 seconds. 
4. Plug in the router and give it plenty of time to fully reboot, at least 3-4 minutes. 
5. Turn on the phone and try to connect. 
6. Open a browser and get into Setup in the router. 
7. Set security encryption to WPA2/AES. Do not use TKIP or AES/TKIP. 
8. Try setting static IP addresses. 
9. Try using Google's DNS servers. 8.8.8.8 for the primary, 8.8.4.4 for the secondary. 
10. Update your router firmware. 
If none of these help and the problem is only with this network, it's possible you have a signal interference problem. 
You need to determine the best setup for your situation and configure the router and phone accordingly. To find the best setup try using WiFi Overview 360. The free version is probably all you need but the Pro version is cheap. https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...ifioverviewpro 
When setting up the 5GHz band usually it's best to set the router to use a channel well over 100. Over 150 if there's a clear channel. For both bands of course use channels with the least interference and best signal as indicated by WiFi Overview 360. 
Android since v1.0. Linux since 2001.

I just bought my wife a new Samsung Galaxy Edge 6 and it is having the same issue. We currently have the Arris DG860. Where do we start? I don't have much knowledge about adjusting the settings on a router...

Well, I guess the best suggestion I have right now is to read my post right above yours. And spend some time with the router user manual. Then post back here with any specific questions.
Android since v1.0. Linux since 2001

I recently picked up a Motorola router and all of my notifications are delayed. Sometimes I'll pick up my phone and wake it up and all of a sudden I'll get an email and 20 minutes worth of WhatsApp messages. That'll also happen if I leave my apartment and it drops off of the WiFi. I tried Port Forwarding port 5228 because this is apparently what Android notifications use....but no success. 
Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated

replies.text: Are you sure your 'Keep Wifi on during sleep' option isn't set to never? It is in the Wifi settings under 'More'.
Have definitely been on "always"

thread.text: The router user manual? I rent the router/modem from WOW cable...😐

replies.text:
There's no manual available online ?
Android since v1.0. Linux user since 2001.

thread.text: Is this happening only with Whatsapp notifications?

So what happens exactly? Does it drop and rejoin frequently or stay disconnected? Typically u want the 2.4 and 5 ghz band on the same ssid so they can handoff to eachother more smoothly. Especially because 5ghz has low range. 
May i suggest a channel change for the 2.4? Also download wifi analyzer or similar app and see your signal strength on your phone in different locations around the house. (Free) Perhaps it's interference. I had an issue where the wifi cut completely off and nothing worked besides
factory reset of router. 
Best, 
Matt

You'll have a lot more options and alot more control over your wifi, along with better range and better wifi stability.

thread.text: Just disable all crap apps, turn off auto sync and location

Step 1) Package Disabler Pro. This by itself will make a massive difference. More or less doubled my time. 
Step 2) Once you've turned off all those inefficient system things, install Nova Prime. Another boost.
Step 3) Package Disabler Pro flags Facebook as a power drain, so turns it off by default. FB itself is just fine, so turn it back on if you want to. ..as long as you turn off checking for updates in the background. THAT will kill you. Just let FB refresh when you open the app.
Step 4) GPS on its own is fine. I also leave on an app called Real Time GPS tracker. It polls GPS and updates my position on the Google map, anywhere between once every 15 seconds and once every 2 minutes depending on whether I'm in motion. 
Very cool app, btw. Works even when you don't have WiFi OR mobile data, strictly by GPS, which gets fed directly to a private Google Maps url. A big deal for living in a remote, sometimes hazardous area where i want my wife to always know where I am. Google already knows where all of us are anyway. LOL Virtually zero drain on my system, though. 
But the thing that will absolutely kill you is Google location history. Turn that thing off, molto pronto. 
Those few small tweaks will make a bigger difference than you can imagine. In addition to GPS, I leave Wi-Fi and mobile data on, and always have my screen to full brightness, NEVER auto lol I want to see that thing as bright as it can be. 
But with those few things taken care of I couldn't be more pleased with the battery life. And of course thrilled by how quickly it charges, even with a standard charger.
Day-yum I love this phone! 
Posted via the Android Central App

Just say " hey OP, I personally find that a little hard to believe, but I guess it's possible. That was lucky. Maybe all is not lost if that happens to me. Nice one." Then carry on! 
The OP was not trying to con someone out of money. 
My Note 3 fell flat on its back from about 12 feet. 
Someone recently returned a Note 4 to the owner that fell out of a small plane while taking a selfie from outside the window on his first trial lesson for his birthday. 
I believe it can happen maybe 10 % of the time. Cushions of air, something like that. 
OP we apologise. 
(now I've got to write to Santa before it's too late)

title: Diference between g928C, g928i & g9287?

thread.text: Can someone clear something up for me I have heard so many different things. What is the difference between the g928c, 928i, and the g9287 is it just the region or does it have to do with the storage size or both? Thanks

The last letter, i is the int'l version. Just like the US here, there is A, V, T and P. Different regions have different end letters, they all have slight different bands as well, so make sure u get one that'll work best with your carrier. Also, they so not represent whether it's a 32 or 64gb. Check gsmarena for more details on the models available.
Sent from my SM-G928T using Tapatalk

Thanks I have At&t here in the USA and want to make sure I get the right one. I am having a hard time finding a white one and the only one I can seem to find is a 928c and I am not sure that will work well with mine I went to Gsmarena and that wasn't much help it didn't show what the g9287, the g928i or the g928g was for. I already know the 928c I believe is from Dubai at least the one I ordered off Amazon that I returned was.

c is the Asian model. If you're on AT&T and trying to get an unlocked International Version, normally you need to plug in these settings to get 4G to work.
Settings/Mobile data/Menu(Top 3 dots)/Mobile Networks/Access point names/Menu again/New APN
Name: ATT Phone
APN: phone
Proxy: Not Set
Port: Not Set
Username: Not Set
Password: Not Set
MMC: http:\\mmsc.mobile.att.net
MMS Proxy: proxy.mobile.att.net
MMS port: 80
MCC: 310
MNC: 410
Authentication Type: None
APN Type: default,mms,fupi,hipri
APN protocol: IPv4
APN roaming protocol: IPv4
So does that mean the one that ends with C would have worked ? It's been a while since I have used an international phone.

replies.text: Don't get me to lying. I'm stuck on VZW. I can only use VZW approved devices. At least there are workarounds for AT&T. If you had one, you can always try the settings above and see if it'll work.

thread.text: Anyone ever buy from Tech Mobility I think their website is techsmobs.com? I was able to find some 64gb ones there.

I ended up ordering a White International G928C from Expansys USA and they were the best price and quickest shipping, great service and the phone works wonderful! I highly recommend them.

title: Why can people on speakerphone,hear my Youtube clips,and text tones?

thread.text:
Hey everyone had to make an account to ask this question from fellow android experts, because i am a bit annoyed, and i need your help.
So I had an older phone (iPhone), and when people where on the phone with me, they would NOT be able to hear my incoming text message tones, or even my texts messages being typed out to people, or even know that i am watching YouTube clips during the phone call...
But for some reason with my new phone (got the S6 edge+), anyone who is on the phone with me, can literally hear incoming text messages, my YouTube clips being played while they are on speaker phone, and my texts typing.. It is a bit annoying sometimes and I would like to know how to solve this problem. Maybe I have a defective phone?
Sometimes I have a friend who keeps on rambling on, and, on, and on about life, and I want to be able to play a YouTube clip without him knowing... NOW he can hear it >_> lol
does this happen to anyone else? any feedback from other people who have tested their phones on this annoyance would be greatly appreciated..

Welcome to Android Central! Is it just if you're on speakerphone? What if you're on a regular non-speakerphone call, and start watching a YouTube video? Can the other person hear it? Maybe you could test that out with a friend (whom you don't find boring  ).
The thing about speakerphone is that the mic will pick up any nearby sound. So if the phone's speaker is blaring the latest Taylor Swift song, the speakerphone mic will pick that up, along with your voice. I'm not sure if this is the case if you're not on speakerphone, which is why I suggested the above.

Like the person said above, or use a headset.
Sent from my SM-G928V using Tapatalk

well the thing is, i tried it with my girlfriends new iphone 6s plus, i told her to put me on loudspeaker, and put a video clip from YouTube on very loud... I heard nothing on my side super quite.. I try it with my s6 edge plus, and she can hear it loud and clear lol.. also she can hear incoming calls that are coming in while i am on the phone with her. which can be a bit annoying if i am making a business call, and someone tries to get a hold of me multiple times, and they can hear it on their end, and say "hey, are you gonna get that?" 
BUT... you might be right it might just be because she is in loudspeaker and the sound from the speakers are so close to the mic that she can hear the feed.. I will have to try and test it out without putting on loudspeaker.. 
thanks for the replies guys.. this is a beautiful phone and i start to nitpick lol..

replies.text:
What I get from this is....don't try to watch porn while on a phone call with your girl. There is a good chance she will hear everything. Thanks for the info!
Posted via the Android Central App

thread.text: There are 3~4 volume controls in Android: Media, notifications/calls, alarms, and device. You should be able to change the notification volume during video play.
What I find equally intriguing is how the iPhone blocks out the YouTube audio when on loudspeaker. That's intuitive.

title: Disabling WiFi made a night and day difference for the battery life.

thread.text:
I was always under the impression that enabling WiFi will increase the battery life. That's how it was on BlackBerry phones in the past as it would alleviate the phone from working hard and getting data/signal from the mobile network so that's how I always had my Galaxy S6 edge+.
I would turn it on in the morning and by 5 PM I'm down to 35% battery life and I barely use my phone!
Today I tried leaving my phone on 4G but no WiFi, I have an unlimited data plan anyway!
now it's 23:39 and I used the phone the same way as I did before, just 2 phone calls and some surfing, battery life is still @ 75%!!! This is insane!!

replies.text:
I'm in the exact opposite boat. At work my LTE signal is 1 bar to 3G to 1x to nothing, then back to 1 bar again. It's constantly changing and looking for a signal, so I have to keep Wifi on and connected. When I leave work, I always turn off the Wi-Fi, because I too am on unlimited data. 
Just curious, have you adjusted your monthly Cellular budget to cover the extra $20 per unlimited line on next month's bill?

This will not be true for everybody. 
In general, wifi will ALWAYS be easier on the battery than 4g/3g. Unless ur router is rubbish. I get the opposite to what u say above. Fantastic battery life on wifi, less battery on mobile data only.
Posted via my SM-G928F

thread.text:
When WiFi is on, your phone is constantly active looking for a connection. It's always been that way. But yes, just like turning off bluetooth when you don't need it will also add some life to the battery. I always keep extra chargers so I don't have an issue with low battery.
Posted via the Android Central App
I have had stellar battery life on the S6E+. I have Wifi, Bluetooth, Location, data and NFC turned on all day and a couple of days ago after 17 hours of on time, I was still at 40%.

It completely depends on our environment if you are in an area with good cellular coverage and poor or intermittent WiFi or many physically different APs to a single network such as a large office turn off WiFi. If you are in an area with poor cellular coverage and a constant WiFi such as at home or at your desk turn off the cell although this is at your desk or at home so it doesn't matter as you can just plugin.
It might help to go to Settings > Wi-Fi > More > Advanced > uncheck "Always allow scanning". This is what I do on my devices and it noticeably improves the battery life.

title: Notification Issue with Non-Samsung SMS App

thread.text:
So I was using the Google Messenger (blue and white text bubbles app) app for my texts and my phone stopped giving me notification noises for my texts and stopped even putting them in the notification tray. I switched back to the Samsung Messages app (yellow envelope app) and I got my notifications back. I went through every setting in the Google SMS app and could not find a single one that was off/muted/anything. So far as I could tell, I should have been getting notifications. Also I"m even more confused by the fact that as soon as I made the Samsung SMS app the default, I started getting text notications again. 
I'm on Tmobile and running 5.1.1.
Anyone else notice this or have a fix for it?
Go to the App Manager, select Google Messenger, and see if the Show Notifications checkbox is on.
Thanks! That worked. Not an entirely intuitive way of handling that.
Great! I wonder why it was off? Do you recall ever going in there to change that setting? Apps usually have that checkbox on by default.
I don't remember it doing it all, but that doesn't mean I didn't do it by accident at some point.

title: Embaressing newb question...

thread.text:
This is such a newb question that I am embarrassed to ask because I SHOULD know this....here goes...
Sending and receiving MMS, is that data used against your data plan or is that included in the "unlimited text" feature with Verizon? I know its sent and received using data but not sure if its deducted from your data plan.
I'm pretty sure it's from your data plan. The unlimited texting probably refers only to SMS.
Multimedia Messaging FAQs | Verizon Wireless

I'm still on unlimited data, so I haven't really cared, but as far as I know, MMS pictures do not count toward your data. It counts as a text, so if you have unlimited texts, then you're safe. Now, if you choose to email those pictures or videos, then yes, they count against your data. However, as for anything, I'd recommend contacting VZW and ask them to make sure that they don't count.

title: Choetech fast wireless charger compared with the Samsung

thread.text:
I have the fast wireless charger from Samsung as well, so this review is a little comparison of the two.
Samsung fast wireless charger:
PROS:
- quality stuff, something you'd expect from a big manufacturer.
- internal fan? not sure if this is a pro or con, but it helps to keep the charger a bit cooler
CONS:
- you could probably hear the fan noise if put next to your bed at sleep times
- expensive at $60-$70, depending on color and merchant.
- only works with the Samsung adaptive fast wall charger, does not work with other qc 2.0 certified wall chargers.
Choetech fast wireless charger:
PROS:
- much smaller in overall size, I like it better than the bigger Samsung one.
- no internal fan or vents. although this could be subjective, only time will tell if there would be a heating issue.
- at only $35 compared to $60-$70.
- works with all the qc 2.0 and Samsung adaptive fast wall chargers.
not really any cons for the choetech, it's much cheaper and works just as well as the Samsung. it even works with all qc 2.0 wall chargers, and that's a big plus. so I really don't see a reason to buy the Samsung unless one is into the big brands.
for the record, I have received this product at a discounted price in return for an honest review.
So, they both charge the same amount of time? How long is that?

Thanks for the observations. Really wonder how much of a difference the internal fan on the Samsung makes. I have the Choetech unit and it gets hot (around 42-43 degrees C), especially after reaching 100% and trickle charging. 
I've actually resorted to using a non-quick charge adapter with the Choetech, since it's my bedside charger and used overnight. No more heat issues, but of course, no fast charging,

Interesting
Posted via the Android Central App

Thanks for sharing. I'm contemplating a fast wire less charger and this helps alot.
Posted via the Android Central App

I purchased the Samsung Fast Wireless Charger yesterday. Am interested in seeing if it generates less heat than the Choetech due to its internal fan.
Interesting that the price of the Samsung unit has dropped since it's initial release. It was $69.99 on Amazon a few weeks ago. I paid $58.99 yesterday. Now there's only a $13 price difference between the Samsung and Choetech units (w/ the bundled power adapter).

The skin appears to have apps built into it. Must be something that can be done with zooper and something like Nova launcher?
Posted via the Android Central App

There are not exactly apps inside those skins. They are templates created with Zooper Widgets and shared through the Play Store. You could create them yourself with just Zooper and a lot of patience 
You can create your own widgets and import some skins just using the stock launcher and Zooper Pro. Other skins will need a custom launcher to work properly (grid size, margins, etc). 
This is my recommendation. Start creating your own widgets, it doesn't matter how simple they are. Use the stock templates or some free skins from the store and play with them. In no time you'll find that those settings are not so scary as you thought  Worth the effort. 
And remember, feel free to ask if you need any help.

thread.text:
I was able to install Samsung Pay on my Edge+ (VZW variant) this morning. Here are some observations:
1. I downloaded and installed the app from the Google Play store. FWIW, I have not yet received the VZW firmware update that supposedly enables Samsung Pay. 
2. Once I opened the app, I was promoted to update to the security policy. However, when I tried doing so, nothing would happen. I remembered I had used Package Disabler Pro to disable numerous items. When I checked my list of disabled apps, I noticed that one pertaining to security updates was disabled. Make sure everything pertaining to Samsung security is not disabled via Package Disabler.
3. Once I re-enabled this app, I reopened Samsung Pay and was able to download the security policy updates. Interesting note though, as part of the install process, my phone downloaded and reinstalled Samsung Pay app, but this version appeared to come from the Samsung App Store. It said it would install over the previously installed version of Samsung Pay. So you need to have created a Samsung account and not disabled this functionality with Package Disabler.
4. After Samsung Pay had finished installing, I was successfully able to add my Am Ex card to my account. Received email confirmations from Samsung Pay and Am Ex that the card was successfully added.

replies.text: Was just about to post this. There's actually no update you need from Verizon just the app from the play store. The problem I had at first was the framework I sideloaded. If you sideloaded the framework you have to hard reset your phone or Samsung pay won't work.

title: Galaxy S6 Edge+ Feezing Problem.

thread.text: I've been having this problem with my S6 Edge+ where randomly if I go turn my phone on (just waking it to unlock) either the screen wont turn on and the phone will be frozen for 10-20 seconds then it will turn on and I'll be able to unlock it, or the screen will turn on and it will also be frozen for 10-20 seconds, then sometimes when I finally unlock it the phone will be frozen and it will kind of reset itself, not restart but take me back to the unlock screen and it will work fine. It doesn't happen often enough for it to seriously annoy me, but if there's a fix I'd love to know. And when the phone is on it runs amazing, never had it freeze up once only when that unlock glitch happens. This might happen maybe once or twice a day max.

I hate to be the bearer of bad news but it's a common problem with the Edge+. There's a similar thread here: http://forums.androidcentral.com/sam...esponsive.html
It's not affecting *ALL* of the units but it's fairly common. Unfortunately no-one has found a solution thus far, hopefully because it's a widespread issue Samsung will fix it in a firmware update. For myself, it's also affecting one of my two Edge+ units.

Thanks VJ, all I wanted to hear, as I said this isn't terrible news, it's probably great news cause it means it's not just my handset that's affected so it will most likely be fixed in a firmware update. Other than that minor fault the phone runs amazing.

replies.text: Yeah, I haven't heard anyone complain about it that it's so bad they decided to exchange the phone. I think typically it happens once every couple of days at most. I can't remember the last time mine did it but I know it happened a few times in the past maybe 1-2 days in between.
Yeah nothing too much to worry about, just a fix would be nice, but overall an amazing phone!
